Don't edit this page, just click on the version number! --> | programming language = [[C++]] | operating system = [[Cross-platform]] | language = [[List of ISO 639-1 codes|bg, cs, de, en, es, fr, hu, it, ms, nl, pl, pt, ro, ru, sv, uk, zh]]<ref>Centericq 4.21.0 Source</ref> | genre = [[Instant messaging]] [[client (computing)|client]] | license = [[GNU General Public License|GPL]] | website = [http://thekonst.net/en/centericq Centericq] }} '''Centericq''' is a text mode menu- and window-driven [[instant messaging]] interface that supports the [[ICQ]], [[Yahoo!]], [[AOL Instant Messenger|AIM]], [[MSN]], [[IRC]], [[Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol|XMPP]], [[LiveJournal]], and [[Gadu-Gadu]] protocols. It allows you to send, receive, and forward messages, URLs, SMSes (both through the [[ICQ]] server and email gateways supported by [[Mirabilis (company)|Mirabilis]]), contacts, and email express messages, and it has many other useful features. Known to work in [[Linux]], [[FreeBSD]], [[NetBSD]], [[OpenBSD]], [[Solaris (operating system)|Solaris]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and [[Mac OS]] X/Darwin Operating Systems.

It also found that IRC support was "excellent" due to support for multiple servers and channels and the ease of switching between them in the âwindowedâ interface.<ref name=fsm/> In September 2002, Steven J. Vaughan-Nichols found it "the greatest of all console IM clients" due to its "excellent interface and a huge number of features and configuration options" in a category review on [[Freshmeat]].<ref>Steven J. Vaughan-Nichols (21 Sep 2002) [http://freshmeat.net/articles/instant-messaging-clients Instant Messaging Clients], [[Freshmeat]] Category Reviews</ref> In 2005 it was also reviewed in [[The Unofficial Apple Weblog]], but despite support for [[.Mac|.mac]] accounts, the reviewer was displeased with the "annoying key combos" required to access the menus, because on [[Mac OS X]] the usual [[function key]] assignments of CenterICQ could not be used. He could also not access the MSN network. Despite this he concluded: "All things considered, I've decided that Centericq is the most stable and intuitive terminal based chat client." <ref>Fabienne Serriere (22 Oct 2005) [http://www.tuaw.com/2005/10/22/terminal-tips-centericq-open-source-chat-aggregator-on-os-x/ Terminal Tips: Centericq open source chat aggregator on OS X], [[The Unofficial Apple Weblog]]</ref>
In November 2007, the project's website stated that CenterICQ is dead.{{Citation needed|date=January 2010}} Because CenterICQ is not actively maintained anymore, other developers forked the project to '''CenterIM''', and applied several security patches and updates. {{Asof|2009}}, CenterIM is still in development; version 4.22.9 was released on December 14. Neither CenterICQ nor CenterIM 4 support [[Unicode]], but support for [[UTF-8]] is planned for CenterIM 5.<ref>[http://www.centerim.org/index.php/Frequently_Asked_Questions#Does.2Fwill_UTF-8_work_in_CenterIM_4.x.3F CenterIM FAQ]</ref>
